snippet: Mr. Barbey vowed to make the alternative weekly newspaper, which boasts a rich history but has struggled in the past decade, culturally relevant again.
abstract: Village Voice, 60-year-old newspaper that was once vital to alternative culture in New York City, is sold by Voice Media Group to Peter D Barbey through his investment company Black Walnut Holdings LLC; Barbey says he is committed to renewing paper's importance to city's cultural landscape.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Barbey vowed to make the alternative weekly newspaper, which boasts a rich history but has struggled in the past decade, culturally relevant again.

headline.main: Village Voice Sold to Peter Barbey, Owner of a Pennsylvania Newspaper
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Investor Buys Village Voice and Pledges to Make It Culturally Relevant Again
